answers.answer: I would like to know the same thing

I did with my first. I was 38 weeks and bp was through the roof. My Dr did a 24 hour urine culture and discovered preeclamsia. I was induced immediately. The swelling is usually way more than a normal pregnancy. Good luck. I'm on baby # 2 and so far so good. You usually don't get it til the end but I have heard some women get it sooner. Keep me posted
I'm 25 weeks and have been having really bad headaches, weight gain that's unreal, chest pain, and my vision is getting really bad

You need to go in right NOW.  Your symptoms  are not normal and "could" be indicative of preeclampsia.  As you know preeclampsia can be life threatening to you and baby so get checked out immediately (not tomorrow, now)
Also have like acid in my throat

I had preeclampsia during my first pregnancy,though due to what I beleive was a lack of care from midvives, they didn't diagnose until the day I went into Labour, once they looked back over my files it was obvious that I had had it for a month or more, after 24hours in hospital the end result was an emergency cesarean. My symptoms were extremely swelling, hands(diagnosed with carpal tunnel syndrome at 20 weeks) feet face and legs, headspins and black spots in vision. Your symptoms need to be checked out asap.
I'm going to call my doc tomorrow

You realize that if you do have preeclampsia and don't get seen NOW as in TODAY you could lose your baby, right?  These symptoms coupled with the bleeding and cramping  you had a few days ago warrant immediate attention. The Risk to you is also very significant but I assume your baby's health is your number one concern and you will seek a medical evaluation for your baby's safety and will not compromise baby's health by waiting this out.

I had it with my last baby. Blood pressure was super high. Protein in urine. Had swelling for weeks that never went down. Had to be induced that day! Preeclampsia can lead to seizures which can be harmful to both you and your baby. I would go to the er, don't wait to speak with out Dr, the hospital will notify your Dr for you

High blood pressure, excessive weight gain and constant selling in legs, arms and face. I got it at 7 months, had a perfectly normally pregnancy then out of no where gained 80lbs in water weight and was induced at 37 weeks from high blood pressure.
I gained 8 pounds in a couple of days. My feet isn't constantly swollen just a lot. My head hurts a lot.

question: Has anyone on here have or had preeclampsia during pregnancy? What was some signs that you have/ had it? What did they do for it?
